memberdef.definition: typedef GG_Result(* GG_LogHandlerFactory) (const char *handler_name, const char *logger_name, GG_LogHandler **handler)
memberdef.name: GG_LogHandlerFactory

detaileddescription.para: Factory function for log handlers.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the handler type to create.
The name of the logger for which the returned handler will be attached to.
Pointer to a variable in which the newly created handler will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the handler could be created, or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: Explicitly initialize the log manager singleton.

It is normally not necessary to call this function, as the log manager can self-initialize upon first use. But in cases where the application needs to initialize the logging subsystem at a specifc point, it may use this function for that purpose.
This function may be called from any thread.
Explicitly terminate the log manager singleton.

It is normally not necessary to call this function, as the log manager can self-terminate upon application exit. But in cases where the application needs to terminate the logging subsystem at a specifc point, it may use this function for that purpose.
This function may be called from any thread.
Register a factory for creating custom log handlers.
Platform specific implementations may want to handle log records using custom handlers.
This function may be called from any thread.

simplesect.para: Calling this method will override the root logger default handler.

parameterdescription.para: The GG_LogHandlerFactory method that will be called to create new "PlatformHandler" handlers.

detaileddescription.para: Register a default factory for creating custom log handlers.
When set, the default log handler factory is called when no other factory (built-in or platform) is suitable to create a log handler by name.

parameterdescription.para: The GG_LogHandlerFactory method that will be called to create new handlers.

memberdef.argsstring: (GG_LoggerReference *self, int level, const char *source_file, unsigned int source_line, const char *source_function, const char *message,...)
memberdef.name: GG_LoggerReference_LogString

detaileddescription.para: Emit a string-based log record through a logger, via a logger reference. If the logger reference's logger isn't initialized, it will be automatically initialized, and the reference will be updated before returning.
This function should not be called directly. It is intended to be used by the logging macros.

memberdef.argsstring: (GG_LoggerReference *self, int level, const char *source_file, unsigned int source_line, const char *source_function, GG_LogObject *object)
memberdef.name: GG_LoggerReference_LogObject

detaileddescription.para: Emit a object-based log record through a logger, via a logger reference. If the logger reference's logger isn't initialized, it will be automatically initialized, and the reference will be updated before returning.
This function should not be called directly. It is intended to be used by the logging macros.
Get the numerical logging level for a logging level name string

simplesect.para: A numerical logging level, or -1 if the name does not exist.

detaileddescription.para: Get the logging level name string for a numerical logging level.

simplesect.para: Logging level name, of an empty string if the numerical level does not have a name.

memberdef.argsstring: (const GG_LogRecord *record, char *buffer, size_t buffer_size, bool use_colors, uint32_t format_filter, bool add_newline)
memberdef.name: GG_Log_FormatRecordToStringBuffer

detaileddescription.para: Format log record to a string based on format filter

parameterdescription.para: Whether to use colors or not
Add a newline (\r ) at the end of the buffer

detaileddescription.para: Get configuration properties for the console handler

simplesect.para: use_colors Whether to use colors or not in log string output
format_filter Filter indicating log string format
